column1: 1329#N-2024-328#Kids' lunch boxes and food safety#`Nowadays
column2: the use of an insulated lunch box is becoming a trend on an account of helping users to consume healthier food
column3: save money
column4: take home-cooked meals. However
column5: flunking in food safety is not an option
column6: especially when children are most vulnerable to foodborne illness. Keep Cold Foods Cold and Hot Foods Hot :

column1: <ul>
• Cold Foods: Always use at least two cold sources like frozen gel packs
column2: frozen juice boxes
column3: or frozen water bottles to keep foods cold. Foods that sit out at room temperature are at risk of entering the “Danger Zone” (temperatures between 5°C and 60°C where bacteria can multiply quickly and cause illness).

column1: • Hot Foods: When packing hot foods like chili
column2: soups
column3: or stews
column4: make sure to use an insulated container to keep the food hot. Keep the container closed until lunchtime to keep the food at 60°C or above.

column1: 2467#N-2025-587#Confronting risks of mirror life#All known life is homochiral. DNA and RNA are made from “righthanded” nucleotides

column3: some researchers had begun work toward creating lifeforms composed entirely of mirror-image biological molecules. Such mirror organisms would constitute a radical departure from known life

column6: how they might be eroded by technological progress
column7: and what we deem to be unprecedented and largely overlooked risks. We call for broader discussion among the global research community

column1: 2592#N-2025-712#Administering a bioprotective strain to live fish in aquaculture prevents growth of Listeria and spoilage bacteria on the processed fillets#Seafood is prone to rapid spoilage and transmission of foodborne diseases. column4: and no significant differences were detected in growth or mortality between the treatment and control groups. However
column5: adding C. divergens V41 to the tank water prior to harvesting markedly changed the fillet microbiome
column6: suppressing the growth of spoilage organisms and thereby possibly extending the shelf-life period. column7: compared with the control group.
